Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish-brown) below; traces of four added white bands; exterior reserved with narrow band on top of rim; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 15)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 643, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0288) (phase 2)
